experiments.name: Initial Discovery
experiments.description: Found NCA bifurcation: either dies (0 alive) or overgrows (4096 alive)
experiments.key_finding: Binary outcomes - no stable middle ground

experiments.name: Multiple Configuration Testing
experiments.key_finding: All resulted in death or overgrowth - confirms systematic issue

experiments.name: Fine-Tuned Parameter Testing
experiments.key_finding: Even precise tuning couldn't escape bifurcation

experiments.name: Research-Based Homeostatic NCA
experiments.description: Implemented attention, memory channels, hardware separation
experiments.key_finding: Perfect stability (1.0) but no dynamics - learned 'do nothing'

experiments.name: Stability-First Curriculum
experiments.description: Progressive training from stability to growth
experiments.key_finding: NCA stayed essentially dead (0.009 alive ratio)

experiments.name: Growth-First Curriculum
experiments.description: Strong growth incentives first, then add stability
experiments.key_finding: Initial improvement (0.129 alive) but still died in later stages

insights.description: Mathematical phenomenon where small parameter changes cause dramatic state shifts
insights.implication: Traditional parameter tuning cannot solve this - need architectural changes

insights.description: Approaches that prioritize stability learn 'do nothing' behavior
insights.implication: Must teach growth first, then add stability constraints

insights.description: Latest research suggests separating immutable hardware from mutable state
insights.implication: Need specialized cell types with different update rules

insights.description: Fast local updates + slow global regulation prevent synchronization
insights.implication: Single-timescale updates may be fundamentally limited

insights.description: Growth-first curriculum achieved 0.129 vs 0.009 alive ratio
insights.implication: Direction is correct but need stronger incentives

research: Distill.pub Growing CA (2020) - Original NCA concepts
Bifurcation theory - Mathematical framework for state transitions
next_steps: 🎯 Test with different loss functions (adversarial, contrastive)
